required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Oncological Surgery in Times of COVID-19: Effectiveness of Preoperative Screening for Sars-Cov-2
clinical_study.official_title: Oncological Surgery in Times of COVID-19: Effectiveness of Preoperative Screening for Sars-Cov-2

lead_sponsor.agency: Instituto Brasileiro de Controle do Cancer

clinical_study.source: Instituto Brasileiro de Controle do Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the incidence of patients with a positive test for SARS-CoV-2, performed in the preoperative screening for patients treated at the institution

detailed_description.textblock: Cohort, prospective, observational study to evaluate the incidence of asymptomatic patients with a positive SARS-CoV-2 test detected in the preoperative screening program of the institution.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of patients with a positive test for SARS-CoV-2, detected in the preoperative screening program
primary_outcome.description: Describe the incidence of patients with a positive test for SARS-CoV-2, detected in the preoperative screening program in our center

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of SARS-CoV-2 infection in the postoperative period in patients with negative screening test;
secondary_outcome.description: Describe the incidence of SARS-CoV-2 infection in the postoperative period in patients with negative screening test.
Postoperative complications will be recorded, according to the Clavien-Dindo classification.
To evaluate the risk of all-cause mortality
Assess the impact of delayed cancer treatment

arm_group.description: Patients who underwent the preoperative screening program for SARS-CoV-2

intervention.description: Screening test for the diagnosis of SARS-CoV-2 in asymptomatic patients

study_pop.textblock: All patients with scheduled elective surgery, including all types of cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with elective surgery scheduled at the IBCC, including those diagnosed with any type of cancer;
- Patients who will undergo the screening test for SARS-COV-2 by RT-PCR (nasal swab), according to the guidelines and protocol of the hospital
Exclusion Criteria:
- Urgent or emergency surgery;
- Screening test for SARS-COV-2 not performed
- Incomplete data in the institutional database

overall_official.affiliation: Instituto Brasileiro de Controle do Cancer

facility.name: Instituto Brasileiro de Controle do Cancer - IBCC
